stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the stream grey-boxing and brainstorming a large, icy castle level (likely Course 13) for “Return to Yoshi’s Island.”  He refines textures, shows new platforming tech (bridges, vanishing doors, appearing paths), and tries to solve the design problem of Star 1: a frozen star the player sees on entry but can’t reach until later.  After rejecting mirrors, cannons, and chandeliers, he settles on rolling a giant snowball into an ice wall to free the star.  He sketches the six-star route, discusses technical limits, and fixes minor model issues.

development_findings.summary: New ‘appearing path’ effect now scales in with a snow-flake pattern instead of popping in.
development_findings.quote: They now grow first and then they slowly grow into the whole thing.  It's not as abrupt anymore.

development_findings.summary: Star 1 concept: player sees a star frozen behind an ice wall within the first seconds of entering the level; solution will be to roll a large snowball into the wall.
development_findings.quote: You walk for a year and just see the big snowball… maybe you push the snowball and you follow it and land right on the star.

development_findings.summary: Alternate ideas (mirror reflection, swinging chandelier, cannon, bomb-cap blast) were tested then dropped for being technically difficult or thematically off.
development_findings.quote: The chandelier idea is actually not good… you’re not going to have enough velocity to realistically shatter this.

development_findings.summary: Swinging chandelier mechanic explored; would require quaternion math not yet in SM64 decomp, so postponed or moved to other rooms.
development_findings.quote: Do I have to program the entire quaternion math? We don’t have any of that in R64 yet.  Seems excessive.

development_findings.summary: Level layout embraces multiple inter-connected paths, each leading to a different star or shortcut, to create an ‘open-ended but directed’ mansion.
development_findings.quote: The idea is just that every path kind of leads to a goal.

development_findings.summary: Planned star list: 1) Ice-wall snowball puzzle; 2) Snowman-cave path; 3) Big Raven boss on rooftop tower; 4) Cold-haze room; 5) Red coins in outside area; 6) Hidden 8-bit pipe (location undecided).
Power-ups currently available for design: bomb cap, ice cap, wing cap, cloud cap.  Fire Flower intentionally excluded.
development_findings.quote: We’re not adding the Fire Flower power-up for one star—that would be silly.

development_findings.summary: Technical priority is now cartridge memory use more than frame-rate; Fast64 and Blender remain core tools; repository is private until next mini-hack release.
development_findings.quote: We are not going to run into performance issues but rather memory issues in this level.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated with Windows updates and is considering switching development to Linux.
context_findings.quote: I think I might become a Linux user in the new year… the shit in Windows 11 just seems too bad.

context_findings.summary: He avoids software updates unless a bug forces him, reflecting a ‘stable tools first’ philosophy.
context_findings.quote: Every time software updates it introduces new bugs and I have to get used to new bugs; the old bugs I’m already used to.

context_findings.summary: He ends the stream early due to a knee injury that makes sitting painful.
context_findings.quote: The knee pain is getting pretty bad and I need to get up, so I will be seeing you guys some other time.

context_findings.summary: Long-term plan: finish this hack, then move on to an original game in Unreal Engine 5.
context_findings.quote: I really just want to finish this game here and then I can move on to that.

biobak.summary: Provided geometry (penguin statue, chandelier parts); Kaze noticed and removed duplicate triangles.
biobak.quote: Did Biobak sneak in a triangle?… that’s six triangles down.

zeina.summary: Active in chat; credited by Kaze for a ‘banger idea’ that improved the level layout (specifics not detailed).
zeina.quote: You missed Lilaa, I'm very sorry about that, Lilaa actually had the banger idea today and you missed it.

key_stories.title: The Frozen Star Puzzle
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants the first star visible at spawn but unreachable.  He experiments with mirrors, chandeliers, bomb caps, and cannons before landing on a snowball-crash concept.
key_stories.process: Mocked mirrors, designed swinging chandeliers, tested bomb caps; finally enlarged the room, placed a stationary giant snowball, and added sloped floor for rolling.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on snowball rolling into an ice wall; room layout adjusted to fit.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the snowball might work better… you push the snowball and follow it right onto the star.

key_stories.title: Chandelier Mechanic That Wasn’t
key_stories.summary: A swinging chandelier that the player could pump to break the ice wall was prototyped.
key_stories.challenge: Needed complex rotation and enough momentum to feel believable.
key_stories.process: Considered single-axis swing vs full physics; realized quaternion math missing from engine.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic shelved for now; may be reused as platforming element in another room.
key_stories.key_quote: Do I have to program the entire quaternion math? We don’t have any of that in R64 yet.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Snowflake Path Texture
key_stories.summary: Kaze hand-designed a tiling snowflake pattern used in dynamic path reveals.
key_stories.challenge: Previous appear-path effect popped in abruptly and lacked theme.
key_stories.process: Created hexagon grid in Photoshop, drew interlocking snowflakes, added growth scaling.
key_stories.outcome: Effect now grows smoothly and visually reinforces ice theme.
key_stories.key_quote: You can’t tell me this is not the coolest thing ever… I invented this pattern.
